title: Elf
content:
Elf Racial Features Base Racial Speed Darkvision Elven Weapon Training Fey Ancestry Keen Senses Subraces High Elf, Wood Elf

Base Racial Speed Darkvision Elven Weapon Training Fey Ancestry Keen Senses

High Elf, Wood Elf

Elf is a Race in Baldur's Gate 3. Elves feature 4 Proficiencies such as Longsword, Shortsword, Longbow, and Shortbow. While creating your Character in Baldur's Gate 3, you can choose between 11 different types of Races. Each of them has their own special characteristics.

BG3 Full Game Note: In the full launch of Baldur's Gate 3, Ability Score Points for Races that were present in Early Access are removed. And instead, Ability Score Points in the full game correspond with the Class players will choose.

With ethereal countenances and long lifespans, elves are at home with nature's power, flourishing in light and dark alike.

Elf Traits & Features in Baldur's Gate 3

Base Racial Speed: Move up to 9m per turn. Darkvision: See in the dark up to 12m. Elven Weapon Training: Proficiency with the Longsword, Shortsword, Shortbow, and Longbow. Fey Ancestry: Advantage on Saving Throws against being Charmed, and magic can't put you to sleep. Keen Senses: Proficiency in the Perception skill.

BG3 Elf Subraces

High Elf: Cantrip: Know one Cantrip of your choice from the Wizard spell list using Intelligence as its spellcasting ability. Wood Elf: Fleet of Foot: Move up to 10.5m per turn. Mask of the Wild: Proficiency in Stealth.

Cantrip: Know one Cantrip of your choice from the Wizard spell list using Intelligence as its spellcasting ability.

Fleet of Foot: Move up to 10.5m per turn. Mask of the Wild: Proficiency in Stealth.

Elf Tips & Notes

During Early Access, the Elf race used to feature +2 Dexterity. This has been changed in the full launch of BG3 and the Ability Score points are now associated with the Class that players will choose. ??
